pull_request.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

pullrequest.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

content.raw:
Yes totally could get rid of `ConstructLookupTableTypeEnabled`,  if we don't want to consider double support at any point. The way it is now, it supports to switch the underlying height map type \`HeightmapShape::HeigthType\` from float to double \(ideally should be a template parameter but that would blow up this PR\). Therefore there are also two `FillHeightfield`signatures, one with float and one with double vectors, so either is supported. However the full benefit of double support will only be achieved once `common::HeightmapData` also supports double. So I see the point of just not providing double support here either, until `common:HeightmapData` can do this as well.

So if that’s disturbing, I can remove it and simplify it back to only float support. I’ll wait for your confirmation before I remove it.
content.html:
Yes totally could get rid of ConstructLookupTableTypeEnabled, if we don't want to consider double support at any point. The way it is now, it supports to switch the underlying height map type `HeightmapShape::HeigthType` from float to double (ideally should be a template parameter but that would blow up this PR). Therefore there are also two FillHeightfieldsignatures, one with float and one with double vectors, so either is supported. However the full benefit of double support will only be achieved once common::HeightmapData also supports double. So I see the point of just not providing double support here either, until common:HeightmapData can do this as well.

So if that’s disturbing, I can remove it and simplify it back to only float support. I’ll wait for your confirmation before I remove it.

content.raw:
@JenniferBuehler  I have left some comments that should be easy to address. Overall, this looks great!

I did get some warnings:

```shell
[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:254] SetParam failed for [collision_detector] in physics engine dart
[Wrn] [PresetManager.cc:82] Couldn't set parameter [collision_detector] in physics engine
```

They seem to be harmless, but it would be nice if we can get rid of them.

 Also, I was wondering if it’s okay with you if I extract out the collision\_detector choice feature into it’s own pull request so it can be merged into gazebo9.
content.html:
@JenniferBuehler I have left some comments that should be easy to address. Overall, this looks great!

I did get some warnings:

[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:254] SetParam failed for [collision_detector] in physics engine dart
[Wrn] [PresetManager.cc:82] Couldn't set parameter [collision_detector] in physics engine

They seem to be harmless, but it would be nice if we can get rid of them.

Also, I was wondering if it’s okay with you if I extract out the collision_detector choice feature into it’s own pull request so it can be merged into gazebo9.

content.html:
In a similar vein as my earlier comment, I think this could be simplified by just using function overloading. So you’d have 

void setOdeHeightfieldDetails(
    const dHeightfieldDataID odeHeightfieldId,
    const float* heights,
    const std::size_t& width,
    const std::size_t& height,
    const std::size_t vertSize,
    double zOffset,
    double thickness)
{
...
}

void setOdeHeightfieldDetails(
    const dHeightfieldDataID odeHeightfieldId,
    const double* heights,
    const std::size_t& width,
    const std::size_t& height,
    const std::size_t vertSize,
    double zOffset,
    double thickness)
{
...
}

content.raw: Can this be simplified by just using the function overloading mechanism? i.e, I’d think we can remove the two `ConstructLookupTableTypeEnabled` functions and just call `this->FillHeightfield(this->heights)` here. If `HeightType` is set to something other than float and double, the would be a compile error because there won't be a matching function for `FillHeightfield`. Thoughts?
content.html: Can this be simplified by just using the function overloading mechanism? i.e, I’d think we can remove the two ConstructLookupTableTypeEnabled functions and just call this->FillHeightfield(this->heights) here. If HeightType is set to something other than float and double, the would be a compile error because there won't be a matching function for FillHeightfield. Thoughts?

pull_request.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

pullrequest.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

content.raw:
I just pushed a commit, now there should be no more related failures. Here is the [build on jenkins](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any/943/).

For 1.\) I decided to not alter the cmake version requirements because that would be too heavy. I just check whether the `collision_detector` tag in `dart` is supported in the SDF, and if it’s not, the test is skipped.

For 2\) and 3\) I removed the temporary enforced failure. Now the tests are just skipped for ODE, until `libdart6-collision-ode-dev` is added to the build environment, then they will be automatically run.
content.html:
I just pushed a commit, now there should be no more related failures. Here is the build on jenkins.

For 1.) I decided to not alter the cmake version requirements because that would be too heavy. I just check whether the collision_detector tag in dart is supported in the SDF, and if it’s not, the test is skipped.

For 2) and 3) I removed the temporary enforced failure. Now the tests are just skipped for ODE, until libdart6-collision-ode-dev is added to the build environment, then they will be automatically run.

pull_request.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

update.description:
This adds support for Heightmaps with DART when using Bullet or ODE collision detectors in DART. It requires changes in [DART PR #1069](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1069) which has recently been merged and included in DART release 6.6.

This relates to issue #909, but it will only fix #909 as soon as DART supports Heightmaps in the default collision detector \(FCL\).

I also found an issue with the heightmaps using the Bullet collision detector when I added the new _TerrainCollision_ test. I have opened a separate issue #2506 for this. Therefore, in this PR the _TerrainCollision_ test is skipped for bullet. When the issue is solved, the test skipping can be undone again.

DART 6.6 is required. For running the complete test, the following dart packages must be installed:

    apt-get install libdart6-dev
    apt-get install libdart6-collision-bullet-dev

and optionally also the use of ODE in dart can be tested, though this is technically not topic of this PR:

    apt-get install libdart6-collision-ode-dev

If the bullet and/or ode extensions are not installed, the tests are skipped.

I have also added some world files which can be used to visually test how heightmaps work.

The following uses a slanted terrain and drops 5 boxes on it. They are expected to roll down the slope.

     gazebo <src-dir>/test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_boxes.world

This world has a valley and drops a sphere on it, which is expected to roll down the valley and stay there.

     gazebo <src-dir>/test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_boxes.world

Use the `-e` parameter to change physics as usual.

When using bullet, you'll see it won't work due to issue #2506.

For DART, it will only work when using Bullet or ODE as DART collision detector. It won't work with the default DART collision detector yet \(which uses FCL\). So to test with DART, we still will need to specify the collision detector to use in the `<physics>` tag. There valley-sphere world has been modified twice to include this tag, once for Bullet and once for ODE:

    gazebo <src-dir>/test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_sphere_dart_bullet.world
    gazebo <src-dir>/test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_sphere_dart_ode.world
update.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

pull_request.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

pullrequest.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

content.raw:
Link to [jenkins build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any/940/). @scpeters , this is ready for the first review now.

There are still 3 related failures:

1.  `HeightmapTest.DartCollisionDetectorSelectionBullet` requires the new SDF version where the `collision_detector` tag was added. I will fix up the version requirements and try to re-build.
2. `DartCollisionDetectorSelectionOde` fails because the dart extension `libdart6-collision-ode-dev` seems to not have been added to the build environment? Anyway this is only an enforced error which I added to find out just that, the test won’t fail after I remove this temporary explicit test failure. It works for the bullet tests, which is the main thing for this PR.
3. `TerrainCollisionDartOde` same reason as 2.
content.html:
Link to jenkins build. @scpeters , this is ready for the first review now.

There are still 3 related failures:

  1. HeightmapTest.DartCollisionDetectorSelectionBullet requires the new SDF version where the collision_detector tag was added. I will fix up the version requirements and try to re-build.
  2. DartCollisionDetectorSelectionOde fails because the dart extension libdart6-collision-ode-dev seems to not have been added to the build environment? Anyway this is only an enforced error which I added to find out just that, the test won’t fail after I remove this temporary explicit test failure. It works for the bullet tests, which is the main thing for this PR.
  3. TerrainCollisionDartOde same reason as 2.

pull_request.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

update.description:
This adds support for Heightmaps with DART when using Bullet or ODE collision detectors in DART. It requires changes in [DART PR #1069](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1069) which has recently been merged and included in DART release 6.6.

This relates to issue #909, but it will only fix #909 as soon as DART supports Heightmaps in the default collision detector \(FCL\).

I also found an issue with the heightmaps using the Bullet collision detector when I added the new _TerrainCollision_ test. I have opened a separate issue #2506 for this. Therefore, in this PR the _TerrainCollision_ test is skipped for bullet. When the issue is solved, the test skipping can be undone again.

DART 6.6 is required. For running the complete test, the following dart packages must be installed:

    apt-get install libdart6-dev
    apt-get install libdart6-collision-bullet-dev

and optionally also the use of ODE in dart can be tested, though this is technically not topic of this PR:

    apt-get install libdart6-collision-ode-dev

If the bullet and/or ode extensions are not installed, the tests are skipped.

I have also added some world files which can be used to visually test how heightmaps work.

The following uses a slanted terrain and drops 5 boxes on it. They are expected to roll down the slope.

     gazebo <src-dir>/test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_boxes.world

This world has a valley and drops a sphere on it, which is expected to roll down the valley and stay there.

     gazebo <src-dir>/test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_boxes.world

Use the `-e` parameter to change physics as usual.

When using bullet, you'll see it won't work due to issue #2506.

For DART, it will only work when using Bullet or ODE as DART collision detector. It won't work with the default DART collision detector yet \(which uses FCL\). So to test with DART, we still will need to specify the collision detector to use in the `<physics>` tag. There valley-sphere world has been modified twice to include this tag, once for Bullet and once for ODE:

    gazebo <src-dir>/test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_sphere_dart_bullet.world
    gazebo <src-dir>/test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_sphere_dart_ode.world

update.description:
This adds support for Heightmaps with DART when using Bullet or ODE collision detectors in DART.  It requires changes in [DART PR #1069](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1069) which has recently been merged and included in DART release 6.6.

This relates to issue #909, but it will only fix #909 as soon as DART supports Heightmaps in the default collision detector \(FCL\).

I also found an issue with the heightmaps using the Bullet collision detector. I have opened a separate issue for this \(see issue #2506\). Therefore, in this PR the Bullet _TerrainCollision_ test is skipped. When the issue is solved, the test skipping can be undone again.

DART 6.6 is required. For running the complete test, the following dart packages must be installed:

apt-get install libdart6-dev  
apt-get install libdart6-collision-bullet-dev

and optionally also the use of ODE in dart can be tested, though this is technically not topic of this PR:

apt-get install libdart6-collision-ode-dev

If the bullet and/or ode extensions are not installed, the tests are skipped.
update.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

pull_request.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

update.description:
This adds support for Heightmaps with DART when using Bullet or ODE collision detectors in DART. It requires changes in [DART PR #1069](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1069).

Relates to issue #909, but it will only fix #909 as soon as DART supports Heightmaps in the default collision detector \(FCL\).

One thing worth noting: While I was working on this I found that collision with heightmaps in Bullet is actually not working at the moment. The terrain is not at the right place. I’ve added two test worlds, [heightmap\_test\_with\_with\_boxes.world](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2956/wip-dart-heightmap-with-bullet-and-ode/diff#chg-test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_boxes.world) and [heightmap\_test\_with\_sphere.world](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/update/2956#chg-test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_sphere.world) which can be used to visually check this.  
 I think this issue is due to the [MotionState::setWorldTransform\(\)](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/src/00e746ff2fc08ad46d2641475b29ddd8b2a10803/gazebo/physics/bullet/BulletHeightmapShape.cc#lines-108) in BulletHeightmapShape \(see comment in linked line\) not actually doing anything with the parameter \(bullet’s terrain has to be translated, see also comment in [btHeightfieldTerrainShape](https://github.com/bulletphysics/bullet3/blob/ab4b6638002c86d7d0c5d4a1b8e5728a227a92e3/src/BulletCollision/CollisionShapes/btHeightfieldTerrainShape.h#L44)\).  
 This issue needs to be investigated, but I think this is a separate issue which should have its own PR. I have added a test which shows that bullet is failing. Before merging this PR this test can be skipped for bullet until the issue is fixed. I’ve left it in there for now for demonstration of the test failure.

pull_request.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

pullrequest.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

content.raw: I’ve updated this PR according to recent changes in [DART PR 1069](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1069), where the height field is now templated with float or double. I’ve created a typedef in [HeightmapShape](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2956/dart-heightmap-with-bullet-and-ode/diff#Lgazebo/physics/HeightmapShape.hhT48) for this, instead of templating it as well, to keep this PR small. So the typedef can be changed to double, but at this point it doesn't make sense because  `common::HeightmapData` always works on float anyway, and I didn't want to touch it for this PR. If at some point `physics::HeightmapShape`    or  `common::HeightmapData`  is also templated with the height field type, it is already supported \(the typedef in `physics::HeightmapShape` would then only have to be changed to the template parameter\).
content.html: I’ve updated this PR according to recent changes in DART PR 1069, where the height field is now templated with float or double. I’ve created a typedef in HeightmapShape for this, instead of templating it as well, to keep this PR small. So the typedef can be changed to double, but at this point it doesn't make sense because common::HeightmapData always works on float anyway, and I didn't want to touch it for this PR. If at some point physics::HeightmapShape or common::HeightmapData is also templated with the height field type, it is already supported (the typedef in physics::HeightmapShape would then only have to be changed to the template parameter).

Relates to issue #909, but it will only fix #909 as soon as DART supports Heightmaps in the default collision detector \(FCL\).

content.raw: Another comment: In the heightmaps test file there are a few tests which currently cause a segfault *after* all the gtest tests have been run \(crash on exit\), I haven't investigated why this is. It is not related to the changes in this PR, but it may be related to having DART support enabled in Gazebo, the crash backtrace came from libdartd.so. I'll check on that again. For now I've disabled the tests in question, see `test/integration/heightmap.cc`
content.html: Another comment: In the heightmaps test file there are a few tests which currently cause a segfault after all the gtest tests have been run (crash on exit), I haven't investigated why this is. It is not related to the changes in this PR, but it may be related to having DART support enabled in Gazebo, the crash backtrace came from libdartd.so. I'll check on that again. For now I've disabled the tests in question, see test/integration/heightmap.cc

pull_request.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

pullrequest.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

content.raw:
Update: The collision detector to use in DART can now be selected in the `<physics><dart><collision_detector>`... entry in the SDF. Because this is a new SDF element, this PR now also depends on the [sdformat PR #404](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/440).

One thing I don't like is that in order to set the parameters in the SDF we need to use a separate SDF file in the tests. That's why there is additionall versions of the `heightmap_test_with_sphere.world` file, they are only copies of the original with the `<physics>` element set accordingly. I don't think that's particularly pretty but couldn't immediately find another way to do this with the `ServerFixture.` Only thing I can think of is to read the SDF separately, modify it, write it to a temporary file and then use that file, which also seems a bit awkward. Thoughts about this?

‌
content.html:
Update: The collision detector to use in DART can now be selected in the <physics><dart><collision_detector>... entry in the SDF. Because this is a new SDF element, this PR now also depends on the sdformat PR #404.

One thing I don't like is that in order to set the parameters in the SDF we need to use a separate SDF file in the tests. That's why there is additionall versions of the heightmap_test_with_sphere.world file, they are only copies of the original with the <physics> element set accordingly. I don't think that's particularly pretty but couldn't immediately find another way to do this with the ServerFixture. Only thing I can think of is to read the SDF separately, modify it, write it to a temporary file and then use that file, which also seems a bit awkward. Thoughts about this?

‌

pull_request.title: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE

update.description:
This adds support for Heightmaps with DART when using Bullet or ODE collision detectors in DART. It requires changes in [DART PR #1069](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1069).

Relates to issue #909, but it will only fix #909 as soon as DART supports Heightmaps in the default collision detector \(FCL\).

One thing worth noting: While I was working on this I found that collision with heightmaps in Bullet is actually not working at the moment. The terrain is not at the right place. I’ve added two test worlds, [heightmap\_test\_with\_with\_boxes.world](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2956/wip-dart-heightmap-with-bullet-and-ode/diff#chg-test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_boxes.world) and [heightmap\_test\_with\_sphere.world](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/update/2956#chg-test/worlds/heightmap_test_with_sphere.world) which can be used to see this.  
 I think this issue is due to the [MotionState::setWorldTransform\(\)](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/pull-requests/new?source=dart_heightmap_with_bullet&t=1#Lgazebo/physics/bullet/BulletHeightmapShape.ccF98T110) not actually doing anything with the parameter \(bullet’s terrain has to be translated, see also comment in [btHeightfieldTerrainShape](https://github.com/bulletphysics/bullet3/blob/ab4b6638002c86d7d0c5d4a1b8e5728a227a92e3/src/BulletCollision/CollisionShapes/btHeightfieldTerrainShape.h#L44)\).  
 This issue needs to be investigated, but I feel this is a separate issue which should have its own PR. I have added a test which shows that bullet is failing.

‌

This is still marked as WIP because we have to decide on a final way to switch the DART collision detector, see also the comment I made inline. It affects [DARTPhysics.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2956/dart-heightmap-with-bullet-and-ode/diff#Lgazebo/physics/dart/DARTPhysics.ccT94).
update.title: WIP: Dart heightmap with bullet and ODE
